definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
forehead/horizontal tablet or inscribed board/specified number or amount

sentences.english: Company has 300 employees, an annual turnover of nearly 40 million RMBs.
sentences.chinese: 公司現有員工300多人，年營業額接近4000萬。

sentences.english: As a general principle, 3% of turnover.
sentences.chinese: 一般說來，應花營業額的3%。

sentences.english: He summed up the turnover for her.
If you appoint us as your general agent, the turnover will be greatly increased.
sentences.chinese: 如果你方能委任我方爲總經理，營業額將大幅度增長。

sentences.english: Our company's annual turnover is over USD $100 million.
sentences.chinese: 友華年度的營業額已經超過了美金一億元。

sentences.english: The takings haven't been totaled yet.
sentences.chinese: 總營業額還沒有被算出來。

sentences.english: But he declined to say what turnover was now.
sentences.chinese: 但他謝絕透露目前的營業額。

sentences.english: Its annual turnover in 2006 reached EUR 410 million.
sentences.chinese: 2006年，迪卡儂全球的營業額爲41億歐元。

sentences.english: They claimed to have many customers per day, but couldn’t tell us how much they sold in a month.
sentences.chinese: 該店聲稱每日顧客熙來攘往，但不能透露月營業額。

sentences.english: Many other manufacturers in China also struggle with high turnover.
sentences.chinese: 中國許多其他的生產商也同樣在爲高營業額掙扎。

sentences.english: In the past year, our company's total turnover reached 30 billion RMB.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的一年裏，我們公司的總營業額達到了30億。

sentences.english: As will be apparent from this bar chart, sales have risen dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 這張柱形圖清楚的表明，營業額有顯著的上升。

sentences.english: Turnover by geographical location is determined on the basis of the destination of shipment of merchandise.
sentences.chinese: 按地區劃分的營業額以貨品付運之目的地而釐定。

sentences.english: Today, Golden Dragon has annual turnover of only m.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，高龍公司的年營業額只有500萬美元。

sentences.english: Sales of this product represented 39% of total turnover in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 這種產品的銷售代表在2009年總營業額的39%。

sentences.english: Turnover refers to the revenue earned in the accounting period.
sentences.chinese: 營業額指在一個財務時間內企業的總銷售收入。

definition: achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
financial year/fiscal year (e.g. from April to March, for tax purposes)
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
